text:
Benjamin of Jerusalem

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Benjamin I of Jerusalem was the 2nd-century 6th bishop of Jerusalem. According to Eusebius of Caesarea he was a Jewish Christian.[1] His short episcopacy was only from about 116 to 117 AD. He was possibly killed in the persecution of Hadrian (117–138), His Feast Day was December 11.[2]

References[edit]

  1. ^ Historia Ecclesiastica, IV, v."
  2. ^ Who was a Christian? Archived 2017-03-25 at the Wayback Machine in the Holy Land.

According to Eusebius of Caesarea he was a Jewish Christian . [1] His short episcopacy was only from about 116 to 117 AD . He was possibly killed in the persecution of Hadrian (117–138),
